title: Some email bodies shown as groups of ASCII characters separated by /
creator: jamesqf
content:
Some emails show a message body that's nothing but / separated groups of ASCII characters, as for example "FJ/OHS/U7R/R3A/NT4/R03/0QY/T1N/VRC/WJ3/J6E/YXK/I6K/WNA..." continued for several pages. These are generally (but I think not always) obvious spam - that one has subject "Try Semaglutide and join the millions of women losing weight fast." But not all obvious spam is shown that way.

Is this something that Thunderbird is doing, or is the gibberish the actual message? I've only bee using Thunderbird for a few months, and don't recall seeing anything like it with my previous email program (Opera). I'm using version 115.7.0 (64-bit) on OpenSUSE Linux.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0

title: How can I change the background colour of a reply or forwarded message I am composing?
creator: JDLH
content:
I have received an HTML-formatted message, which arrived with a red background colour. When I reply or forward that message, the message composition window appears with the same red background colour, and with black text. The resulting black text on a red background is hard to read.

How can I change the background colour of the reply or forwarded message which I am composing? How can I override the background colour set by the sender in the original message?

Note that I am asking about the background colour of a message which was set by the sender. I am not asking about how to set the default colour of messages I compose from scratch. Nor am I asking about how to set the background colour of Thunderbird windows or UI elements.

Thank you in advance.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:132.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/132.0;solver_id:1110132

title: Server Timeout despite connection
creator: jakob.jauk63
content:
Hi Support, A customer uses Thunderbird as their main mail platform but suddenly cannot send or receive messages. error message as follows: Sending message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to the SMTP server timed out. Try again. we get this message directly when we click send (1ms)

Now we checked our Mail Server, connection is up also TLS to port 587 works fine but the client can not establish a connection... it worked a few days ago tho. We also tried to reinstall Thunderbird, new profiles and also tried debugging but we could not find the mistake.

BR, Jakob Jauk

title: Uitgaande mail van gmail werkt niet in Thunderbird- melding verbinding uitgaande smtp-server is mislukt
creator: ifvanm
content:
De uitgaande mail van gmail werkt ineens niet meer in Thunderbird 128.5.0esr (64-bits). Melding: Verzenden van het bericht is mislukt. Het bericht kon niet worden verzonden, omdat het verbinden met uitgaande (SMTP-)server is mislukt. Mogelijk is de server niet beschikbaar of weigert SMTP-verbindingen. Controleer of de instellingen van uw uitgaande (SMTP-)server juist zijn en probeer het opnieuw."

Ontvangen van e-mail gaat prima, concepten opslaan ook. Gmail op de telefoon werkt ook goed. Er is een update van Thunderbird geweest.

Als ik het ondersteuningsartikel lees https://mzl.la/3Pd9PXR en de stappen volg, kom ik niet uit de laatste stap, (maar misschien is er iets heel anders aan de hand?):

De virusscanner even uitgeschakeld Cookies staan op accepteren Javascript op enabled Er staan tokens ingevuld bij oauth:// Accountauthenticatie staat ingevuld als OAuth2

Nu staat er in het Support artikel dat "Als account authenticatie is ingesteld op OAuth2 en OAuth-aanmelding niet succesvol was, controleer dan uw wachtwoordvermeldingen op providers in de volgende vorm en verwijder ze -imap//imap.gmail.com... en -smtp://smtp.gmail.com..."

Hoe weet ik of de OAuth-aanmelding succesvol was? Moet ik nu de regels met de wachtwoorden van de imap en de smtp helemaal verwijderen?

Ik ben niet de enige met dit probleem.

Groet Iris
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:133.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/133.0

title: Neu- Installation des E-Mail Programms Thunderbird
creator: fkklein
content:
Hallo und guten Tag,

Bei der Installation von Thunderbird auf meinem PC gibt es Probleme. Leider kann Ihr Server mein Programm nicht anmelden. Die Konfiguration ist angeblich nicht korrekt. Vor einigen Jahren habe ich schon einmal mit dem E-Mail Programm Thunderbird gearbeitet. Offensichtlich sind in Ihrem Server noch die alten Daten (Passwort und Benutzername) gespeichert. Bitte löschen Sie diese und geben Sie jetzt die neuen Daten ein. Bei der jetzigen Installation handelt es sich um eine Neu-Installation auf einem anderen Computer.

Vielen Dank und freundliche Grüße

content: On 11/21/24 at 12:43 PM all incoming and outgoing email stopped. There are currently over 250 emails in our account that I cannot download. Current version 128.5. Equipment is Dell desk top GTK5PC6 running Win11 (this may be the problem but I'm starting here first - Win help is anything but). The desk top is 64 bit with 500mb hd, Intel Core X-64 processor, 16GB ram.

title: All Messages and Folders Have Disappeared - Asking to Set Up Anew - ?Problem with v.128.5.0esr
creator: lyses-03-havens
content:
Hello -

When I opened T-bird today, the entire account appeared to be missing, along with all of the associated messages.

I had not used T-bird for about a week, and so it had updated automatically to v.128.5.0esr from v.128.4.3esr. I did go to the Help > TroubleshootingInformation > Mail and News Accounts, and there's nothing there. Similarly, I went to ... > Profiles > about:profiles and did not see my default profile there.

Is this a problem of the most recent update? How do I restore my previous email account and settings?

Appreciate anyone's assistance with this.

title: Login to Server pop.centurylink.net failed
creator: mwmedgar
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for ~ 5 years & had to buy a new pc. Now the updated new Thunderbird is repeatedly have issues with each email account showing the automatic Login for new mail is failing to work. The error message says 'LOGIN TO (EMAIL ADDRESS) ACCT FAILED: LOGIN TO SERVER POP.CENTURYLINK.NET WITH USERNAME (EMAILADDRESS) FAILED'.

Oddly enough sometimes this does NOT happen when I restart the program & everything seems to work fine without me changing a thing. Is this an issue occurring system wide now or am I missing something?

title: how to change mail accounts? / all mails from several accounts in one list possible?
creator: romy
content:
Hello thunderbird friends!

After what feels like a break of over 10 years, I have a computer again and have returned to Thunderbird. After setting up several mail accounts, I'm wondering how I can switch between them in the view. I only see one account at a time. I don't know how to get to the other account.

My second question is, how do I create a mail overview in which all emails from all mail accounts can be seen? I have this function in my Mail app on the iPhone and I find it very useful. Is this also available in Thunderbird?

Thank you and best regards from Germany

Translated with DeepL.com (free version)


edit: I have found the option to change accounts. At least I can now switch between the mail inboxes. To do this, activate view/window layout and account view. My problem now is the following. I have a laptop and the display is quite small. With this type of display I now have 3 columns open. The account selection. The inbox of the respective account and on the right the email view. Everything is very small.

I would still like to have a single folder in which all emails can be seen. It would also be nice if there was a button at the top, for example Accounts, where I can click on it and a drop-down menu opens with the respective account.

Another thing that bothers me in the long account list is the long scrolling. Because I have drafts, trash, spam archive, etc... in every account. If I want to retrieve emails from my 5th email account, I have to scroll for a long time until I find the inbox. I hope you understand what I mean. It would be nice if there were favorites, for example only from the inboxes. this would reduce the clutter to a few points and you wouldn't have to scroll so much.

Translated with DeepL.com (free version)
